Articles.Content:
A fork of the old [PlanetRandomizer](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/91363-WIP-Planet-Randomizer-0-2-4-%282014-09-21%29) mod by metaphor. The plugin has been updated for 1.0 and various things have changed, including saving new planet data in the persistence node, rather than a separate config.

In addition, Kerbin will attempt to be placed inside the habitable zone so that planets will appear in both higher and lower orbits.

Note: Rarely, there may be a bug in which your vessel spawns in deep space. If this occurs, revert or return and time warp a bit from the space center.

[Pictures](http://imgur.com/a/27OdA#0)

Download from [KerbalStuff](https://kerbalstuff.com/mod/768/PlanetScrambler)

[Source Code](https://github.com/CelMech/PlanetScrambler)

This work is licensed under a [Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License](http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/).
Glad someone is continuing metaphor's work.
If this could be changed to generate Kopernicus configs, I would use it to make a new Alternis Kerbol-like mod, as KillAshley gave me a red giant Kerbol config.

It's interesting that you should be the first reply, I spent a lot of time ensuring that the mod would work smoothly with mods like Outer Planets that add new bodies.

As for Kopernicus, I really have no idea how to use it.
